Name: Guest
Comment: A placeholder is no more than an insertion point (a tag) on a page template (see Page Templates) to identify where there is a contribution region (that is editable area) on the web page.

Name: Guest
Comment: An image placeholder is a dummy image designed to draw attention to the need for an actual image. Wikipedia image placeholders were meant to be used on articles especially those of living people for the purpose of trying to obtain a freely-licensed image for them.
